waflite
  • API
  • View page source

API

Core scanning/decision logic.

The module contains scoring rules and request normalization utilities.

exception waflite.core.CfgErr[source]

Raised when config/rules are invalid.

class waflite.core.Rl(rid: str, rtp: str, w: int, ps: tuple[str, ...], fld: str = 'req')[source]

Single detection rule.

Parameters:

  • rid – Rule identifier.

  • rtp – Rule type (e.g. “re”, “sub”).

  • w – Rule weight (score add).

  • ps – Patterns (regexes or substrings depending on type).

  • fld – Field name in request dict to inspect.

exception waflite.core.WfErr[source]

Base exception for waflite.

waflite.core.dec(s: int, thr: int) → str[source]

Decision from score.

Parameters:

  • s – Score.

  • thr – Threshold.

Returns:

“block” if s >= thr else “allow”.

waflite.core.mtch(rl: Rl, rq: Mapping[str, Any]) → bool[source]

Check if rule matches request.

Parameters:

  • rl – Rule.

  • rq – Normalized request mapping.

Returns:

True if matched, else False.

Raises:

CfgErr – If rule has unsupported type.

waflite.core.nrq(d: Mapping[str, Any]) → dict[str, Any][source]

Normalize request dict.

Parameters:

d – Request mapping (may be partial).

Returns:

ip, req, ua, st.

Return type:

New dict with stable keys

waflite.core.scr(rls: Iterable[Rl], rq: Mapping[str, Any]) → tuple[int, list[str]][source]

Compute total score and matched rule ids.

Parameters:

  • rls – Iterable of rules.

  • rq – Normalized request mapping.

Returns:

(score, matched_rule_ids)

I/O helpers and parsers for input lines.

Supports: - nginx combined access log lines - raw request lines

exception waflite.io.InpErr[source]

Raised when input cannot be parsed.

class waflite.io.PrsRes(ip: str, req: str, ua: str, st: int = 0)[source]

Parsed request record.

Parameters:

  • ip – Client IP.

  • req – Request line (e.g. “GET / HTTP/1.1”).

  • ua – User-Agent.

  • st – Status code (0 if unknown).

asd() → dict[str, Any][source]

Convert to dict.

waflite.io.prs(fmt: str, ln: str) → PrsRes[source]

Dispatch parser by format.

Parameters:

  • fmt – “nginx” or “raw”.

  • ln – Line.

Returns:

Parsed record.

Raises:

InpErr – If format is unsupported or parsing fails.

waflite.io.prs_ng(ln: str) → PrsRes[source]

Parse nginx combined access log line.

The parser is intentionally small and matches common combined format.

Parameters:

ln – Nginx access log line.

Returns:

Parsed record (ip, request, ua, status).

Raises:

InpErr – If line does not look like combined log.

waflite.io.prs_raw(ln: str) → PrsRes[source]

Parse a raw request line.

Expected formats: - “IP<TAB>REQ<TAB>UA” - “REQ” (IP/UA become empty)

Parameters:

ln – Input line.

Returns:

Parsed record.

waflite.io.rdln(p: Path) → Iterator[str][source]

Read non-empty lines from a UTF-8 text file.

Parameters:

p – Path to input file.

Yields:

Stripped lines.

Raises:

InpErr – If file cannot be read as UTF-8.

Rules and config loader.

waflite.rules.dfl_rls() → list[Rl][source]

Default ruleset.

Returns:

List of rules with simple patterns for common web attacks.

waflite.rules.ld_cfg(p: Path | None) → dict[str, Any][source]

Load config JSON.

Parameters:

p – Path to config JSON or None.

Returns:

thr, rls, ign_ua.

Return type:

Dict with keys

Raises:

CfgErr – If config cannot be loaded or invalid.

waflite.rules.ld_rls(d: dict[str, Any]) → tuple[int, list[Rl], list[str]][source]

Build rules from loaded config.

Parameters:

d – Config dict from ld_cfg.

Returns:

(thr, rules, ign_ua)

Raises:

CfgErr – If rules are malformed.

Reporting utilities.

exception waflite.rep.OutErr[source]

Raised when report cannot be written.

waflite.rep.wr_csv(p: Path, rows: Iterable[Mapping[str, Any]]) → None[source]

Write report as CSV.

Parameters:

  • p – Output path.

  • rows – Iterable of dict-like rows.

Raises:

OutErr – On write errors.

waflite.rep.wr_jsonl(p: Path, rows: Iterable[Mapping[str, Any]]) → None[source]

Write report as JSON Lines.

Parameters:

  • p – Output path.

  • rows – Iterable of dict-like rows.

Raises:

OutErr – On write errors.

CLI for waflite.

waflite.cli.run_cli(argv: list[str] | None = None) → int[source]

Run CLI.

Parameters:

argv – Arguments list without program name.

Returns:

Exit code (0 ok, 2 on handled error).

Web app: панель правил + demo shop.

Панель: - список правил - добавление/удаление - тест строки

Shop (demo): - каталог, категории, поиск, сортировка - карточка товара - корзина (cookie) - checkout + создание заказа (в памяти, на время процесса)

WAF: middleware для /shop и /api/shop.

exception waflite.webapp.DbErr[source]

Ошибка хранилища правил.

waflite.webapp.mk_app(dbp: Path) → FastAPI[source]

Create FastAPI app.

Parameters:

dbp – Path to rules db json.

Returns:

FastAPI app.

CLI runner for web app.

HTTP API для WAF.

Этот модуль дает отдельный API (без UI), чтобы: - проверять одиночный запрос (scan) - проверять пачку запросов (batch) - управлять базой правил (get/put) - получать статистику (stats)

API сделан на FastAPI, чтобы: - была живая документация Swagger/OpenAPI на /docs и /openapi.json - удобно тестировать через TestClient

Формат базы правил (db json): - thr: int - ign_ua: list[str] - rls: list[dict] (поля: rid, rtp, w, ps, fld)

class waflite.api.BatchIn(*, items: list[ScanIn])[source]

Input schema for batch scan.

items

List of ScanIn objects.

Type:

list[waflite.api.ScanIn]

class waflite.api.ScanIn(*, ip: str = '', req: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1)], ua: str = '', st: int = 0)[source]

str

str

User-Agent.

Type:

str

st

HTTP status if known (0 otherwise).

Type:

int

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class waflite.api.ScanOut(*, scr: int, dec: str, thr: int, m: list[str])[source]

Output schema for scan endpoints.

scr

Score.

Type:

int

dec

Decision: “allow” or “block”.

Type:

str

thr

Threshold used.

Type:

int

m

Matched rule ids.

Type:

list[str]

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class waflite.api.StatsOut(*, up_s: float, scans: int, blocks: int)[source]
